text: {| |} Ganadoga, originally designated YT-390, was reclassified YTB-390 on 15 May 1944; laid down 2 August 1944 by Consolidated Shipbuilding Corp., Morris Heights, N.Y.; launched 9 September 1944; and placed in service 15 December 1944. Ganadoga was assigned to 5th Naval District, Norfolk, and performed miscellaneous harbor operations for the next 18 years. She was reclassified YTM-390 on 1 February 1962, and in December of that year she was transferred to the 6th Naval District at Charleston, SC. In 1980 she was expended as a target in support of fleet exercises. ==References== * * NavSource Online: Service Ship Photo Archive Ganadoga (YTM-390) Category:Sassaba-class tugs Category:Ships built in Morris Heights, Bronx Category:1944 ships Category:World War II auxiliary ships of the United States
title: USS Ganadoga (YTM-390)
